glosses: to get tired of, become disgusted with

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish بزمك (bezmek, “to get tired of, become disgusted with”), from Proto-Turkic *bẹŕ- (“to shiver, tremble; to hate, be bored, feel aversion”).
Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (bez-, “to shiver, tremble”), Azerbaijani bezmək (“to feel aversion”), Kyrgyz безүү (bezüü, “to be fed up with”), Turkmen bezikmek, Uzbek bezmoq.
